title: @Meddler, about this Syndra buff on the PBE
body:
I feel mana per level is a step in the right direction for Syndra, as a champion who relies on comboing her abilities together, she consumes a lot of mana really fast, and increasing her per level amount would really help her in the long run.

Though I am curious, will these be the only changes we see this patch or are you guys still looking into changing her passive bonuses? Or are you putting that off for another patch in favor of stability for Worlds?

I wouldn't blame you, back before the changes to her E she was super broken, and the value of stability for Worlds is definitely something to consider.

Yeah, we took a look at mana spent over time if chain casting and Syndra's right up there with mages like Anivia and Karthus. Buffing her mana pool seemed like a good thing to look at as a result, hence we're testing that, give her a bit more staying power in longer engagements/an extra spell per back in lane (on average). We've also got a fix in for certain cases where spheres near, but not past, max E range wouldn't get knocked back.

That might be it for 5.18, though the balance team's still got a few more days to iterate before we need to lock the patch down. Worlds stability is pretty important this patch, so we're generally going for lighter than normal changes where appropriate.

So Transcendence buffs are being held off then? Also what about the buffs to Miss Fortune that were promised? Are those also being put off until another patch...? :( I was honestly filled with anticipation this week, hoping that the Syndra and Miss Fortune changes would hit PBE for 5.18... :[ Please don't break our hearts, Meddler... As meddler said, syndra's mana usage is on par with Karthus and Anivia, but unlike them Syndra doesn't do well with tear or rod of ages because she relies on CDR to do her damage.

Mana per level is a good idea for her and should give her some more staying power.

This is what I was thinking, I just wanted a red to give some confirmation.
Mana per level would not help her at all, by the time that extra mana is going to impact anything she stops needing it because by then she has a mana regen item anyway.

By level 10 the increase would be an extra cast of W or two, depending on the mana regeneration of the syndra in question. Is it a huge change? No. But it has the potential to make a difference once in a while.

Syndra doesn't need a LOT of help. She just needs a bit of a nudge.
Can she get a real passive next?
